page.title: 15ANNUAL EVENTS 2
page.content: Every May there is a Dunster Festival where many villagers dress up in period costume and the village streets are decorated with bunting. The Festival was started on an annual basis on the occasion of Queen Elizabeth's II Silver Jubilee. Down the centre of the High Street are a range of stalls selling home-made goods, others with games of chance or demonstrations. These stalls are a reminder of the times when 'The Shambles' stretched the length of the High Street many years ago. The entertainment also includes folk dancing, exhibitions, dances and Village Sports. The festivities take place over two days, a Sunday and a Monday on one of the Bank Holidays.
